title: RAK12012 WisBlock Heart Rate Sensor Module Datasheet > RAK12012 WisBlock Heart Rate Sensor Module Datasheet > Overview > Description > RAK12012: Pulse Oximetry and Heart-Rate Monitor Module Overview
content: The RAK12012, a part of WisBlock Sensor, is an integrated pulse oximetry and heart-rate monitor module used for measuring person's heart rate and oxygen saturation. The sensor attached to this module is MAX30102 from Analog Devices.
parent_content: The RAK12012, a part of WisBlock Sensor, is an integrated pulse oximetry and heart-rate monitor module used for measuring person's heart rate and oxygen saturation. The sensor attached to this module is MAX30102 from Analog Devices.

title: RAK12012 WisBlock Heart Rate Sensor Module Datasheet > RAK12012 WisBlock Heart Rate Sensor Module Datasheet > Specifications > Overview > Mounting > RAK12012 WisBlock Heart Rate Sensor Module Mounting Mechanism
content:
The RAK12012 WisBlock Heart Rate Sensor Module can be mounted to the IO slot of the [WisBlock Base](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisblock#wisblock-base) board. **Figure 1** shows the mounting mechanism of the RAK12012 on a WisBlock Base module.  
> **Image:** RAK12012 WisBlock Heart Rate Sensor Module Mounting
parent_content:
The RAK12012 WisBlock Heart Rate Sensor Module can be mounted to the IO slot of the [WisBlock Base](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisblock#wisblock-base) board. **Figure 1** shows the mounting mechanism of the RAK12012 on a WisBlock Base module.  
> **Image:** RAK12012 WisBlock Heart Rate Sensor Module Mounting  
With the [RAK19008 FPC Cable](https://store.rakwireless.com/)，RAK12012 can separated from the WisBlock Base board. The two (2) slots of the board are for the rubber bands. The rubber bands can help to press the sensor against the finger or wrist.  
> **Image:** RAK12012 WisBlock Heart Rate Sensor Module Mounting With Rubber Band

title: RAK12012 WisBlock Heart Rate Sensor Module Datasheet > RAK12012 WisBlock Heart Rate Sensor Module Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Pin Definition > RAK12012 WisBlock Heart Rate Sensor Pinout and Power Management
content:
The RAK12012 WisBlock Heart Rate Sensor comprises a standard WisBlock connector. The WisBlock connector allows the RAK12012 module to be mounted to a WisBlock Base board. The pin order of the connector and the pinout definition is shown in **Figure 3**.  
> **TIP:** NOTE
- **I2C** related pins: **INT**,**3V3_S**, and **GND** are connected to WisIO connector.
parent_content:
The RAK12012 WisBlock Heart Rate Sensor comprises a standard WisBlock connector. The WisBlock connector allows the RAK12012 module to be mounted to a WisBlock Base board. The pin order of the connector and the pinout definition is shown in **Figure 3**.  
> **TIP:** NOTE
- **I2C** related pins: **INT**,**3V3_S**, and **GND** are connected to WisIO connector.
- **3V3_S** voltage output from the WisBlock Base that powers the RAK12012 module can be controlled by the WisBlock Core via WB_IO2 (WisBlock IO2 pin). This makes the module ideal for low-power IoT projects since the WisBlock Core can totally disconnect the power of the RAK12012 module.  
> **Image:** RAK12012 WisBlock Heart Rate Sensor Module Pinout

title: RAK12012 WisBlock Heart Rate Sensor Module Datasheet > RAK12012 WisBlock Heart Rate Sensor Module Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Schematic Diagram > Voltage Level Transfer > Voltage Level Transfer for MAX30102 and RAK12012
content:
The MAX30102 IO voltage is 1.8V and the CPU module voltage is 3.3V, so the voltage level transfer is needed. Pull-up Resistor for I2C_SCL and I2C_SDA already exist on WisBlock Base board，so there is no need to connect（NC）on IO module such as RAK12012.  
> **Image:** The Voltage Level Transfer Circuit

content:
INT is an active-low interrupt (Open-Drain). This needs to be connected to an external voltage with a pull-up resistor **R7**.
